Even the playing field with Arbiters of Peace and the Arbiters of War. Protect your squads with the Shimmerstone Clerics' Barrier ability. Use Light Clan's special ability — Prayer — to manipulate the initiative track or grab just the card you need at a crucial moment in battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crystal Clans: Fire Clan
Description:
Behold the all-consuming fury of Fire Clan. This new clan for Crystal Clans burns brightly, but players must make careful sacrifices to stoke their flames or risk them burning out. Deliver vengeance for your fallen heroes with the Ashen Assassins. Create an endless cycle of warriors by utilizing the combined powers of the Searing Guards and Obsidian Defenders. Watch your foes turn to ash merely by being in the burning presence of the hero Meldien.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Roam Across Rhovanion
Description:
Roam Across Rhovanion is the second Adventure Pack in the "Ered Mithrin" cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game. After venturing deep into the Grey Mountains, your path leads to the orcish stronghold of Gundabad. Before you can infiltrate this fortress, however, you must forge an uneasy alliance with a treacherous Goblin and travel across Rhovanion in search of his lost items.

This pack's sixty cards include the first hero to bear the Woodman trait, forming the foundation for an entirely new type of deck. Additionally, the pack contains three copies each of eight different player cards, including some that bring some relief to the encounter deck itself.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Picture This: The Puzzling Picture Game
Description:
In this game, you will be presented with a series of puzzling close up photographs.

A card is placed face up in the middle of the table. Players study the card and the first person to correctly guess what the picture is wins the card. If no one guesses the card within a minute, a new card replaces the previous one.

The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game!

Contents: 100 cards showing close-up everyday objects and instructions.

Name: Het Grote Nieuws van 2001 Spel
Description:
A journalism themed trivia game.

Each player gets a card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the christmas card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the christmas card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Professor Evil and the Citadel of Time: Professor Evil and the Architects of Magic
Description:
The Professor Evil and the Architects of Magic expansion brings new surprises to Professor Evil and the Citadel of Time.

Lloyd Right and Morgane Cardini are two new members of your team, each with a new skills that may help you beat the Professor. You are free to combine Lloyd and Morgane’s talents with those of your favourite characters in any way you wish, and then once again do battle with the Professor!

The Professor’s Possessions are new treasure tiles that represent one of the Professor’s most prized personal artefacts. Mix these new treasures with the others, and then look out for them when they appear around the Castle. If you can rescue a possession it will give the team a boost, but if the Professor stashes a possession before you get to it, you’ll start to hear the clock tick even faster. Beware!

The Time Portals allow the Professor to make use of his own amazing time travel technology — to manipulate time within the Castle itself! When he moves around the Castle, the Professor will open time portals in each room he stops in. And if he ever revisits one, he will jump back in time and repeat his turn, making him an even-more forbidable opponent!

Name: Dueling Dinos
Description:
Duel your dinos and show the other cave clans who is the strongest!

Dueling Dinos is a card game in which the object is to outsmart your opponent and gather rewards. Each player drafts a pack of dinosaurs (dinos), wagers precious stones (tokens), and then watches as their dinos take on their opponents dinos in head to head duels.

Each player is dealt a hand of three cards which are arranged in a line face down. These cards are their pack of dinos. Players take turns successively replacing these cards from the deck or discard pile until one player is satisfied with their pack and knocks. The aim is to make a pack that can win the most head to head duels.

When you think you have the best chance of winning the round you can use your turn to knock instead of drawing to replace one of your cards. This causes the play to end after each of the other players has taken one more turn.

The game is played across five rounds and the player with the most stones at the end of those five rounds is the winner. If, at the start of a round, a player can not ante three coins the game is over and that player has lost. Alternately, before the game begins, players may agree upon a set time limit or number of rounds for the game.

Name: Gib acht!: Das hochinteressante Farben-Kreiselspiel
Description: The players have to move their pawn from the starting space of their color to their destination at the center of the game board. movement is determined by the spin of a color top. the pawn of the resulting color moves 1 space in forward. If a player spins his own color, he gets to spin again. To beginn and to reach the finish, the players have to spin their own color.

Name: Nations At War: Core Rules
Description:
Nations At War v3.0 rules are the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Sean Druelinger, Lead Developer of the Nations At War Series.


These rules present the core rules for the game system.  This new rule book has been designed to place all the rules in one book, making playing the game is easier and faster than ever.


Notable changes from previous versions of the rules (v2.0 and earlier) will be presented in BLUE text. This new edition of the rules can be used with previously published modules.


These new rules also include our new Starter Kit for those who wish to try out the system.

PLEASE NOTE: There is no difference between the Living Rules PDF Edition and the Printed Edition.  This printed book was designed with the gamer in mind and those that have older editions games in the series but wanted to have a hard copy set of the new rules in their hands.

The new rules are available for anyone to download for free.
Families: Series: Nations at War (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

Name: Geisha
Description:
In Geisha, each player will seek to become the geisha with the best reputation in Kyoto. For this, it is necessary to practice different arts: Haiku (poetry), Ikebana (floral arrangements), Ocha (tea), Shamisen (musical instrument) and Uta (singing). The more these arts are practiced, the better the attributes of the geisha: patience, discipline, creativity, dedication and elegance. These attributes will allow the geisha to travel to many teahouses throughout Japan and gain even more reputation.

The player will do so by placing three workers each turn. The spaces to place workers are unique minigames to practice arts and improve their attributes or go to teahouses throughout Japan to directly raise their reputation. At the end of the game, the player who has visited more prefectures will have a better reputation.

The game lasts for 12 rounds, marked with an incense. It marks the duration of a geisha's tea ceremony in reality, so this game takes that idea to mark the end of the game.

—description from the publisher (Translated)

En Geisha, cada jugador buscará convertirse en la geisha con mejor reputación de Kyoto. Para ello, es necesario practicar distintas artes: Haiku (poesía), Ikebana (arreglos florales), Ocha (té), Shamisen (instrumento musical) y Uta (canto). Mientras más se practiquen estas artes, mejores serán los atributos de la geisha: paciencia, disciplina, creatividad, dedicación y elegancia. Estos atributos a su vez permitirán que la geisha pueda viajar a muchas casas de té a lo largo de Japón y ganar aún más reputación.

El jugador hará lo anterior colocando tres trabajadores cada turno. Los espacios para colocar trabajadores son distintos minijuegos para practicar artes y mejorar sus atributos o bien ir a casas de té a lo largo de Japón para subir directamente su reputación. Al final del juego tendrá mayor reputación el jugador que haya visitado más prefecturas.

El juego tiene una duración de 12 rondas, marcadas con un incienso. Èl marca la duración de una ceremonia de té de una geisha en la realidad, así que este juego retoma la idea para marcar el final del juego.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: So Ded
Description:
So Ded is a fast-paced game of survival for 5-24* players (2-4 player rules available), ages 12+, with a 30 minutes playtime

The world has ended by gene slicing bees with humans!! Or maybe it's zombies or something else! On top of that, everyone left alive is out to get you. With random maps, weapons, armor, supplies and other unique gear, you will collect as much loot as you can while fighting anyone that gets in your way! You start with a few knives, leather vests, supplies and ability to Hide.  You gain more powerful equipment by visiting locations but you can also get loot from any opponent's deck when you defeat them

Everyone selects (or chooses randomly) a character to play. There is the Truck Driver, Clown, Hoarder, Surgeon, Cat Lover, etc.. each character has their own unique abilities. The game is broken down into 3 phases: Move, Battle/Loot, Apocalypse/Refresh.  BE WARNED: People will be eliminated at a fast pace! Only one will survive. So if you pull out a victory in this game, you should be praised in all of it's glory as it will be rare indeed

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Kansas City Interurban
Description:
Kansas City’s boom days of interurban railways started in the early 1900s and went away just as fast in the 1930s due to the rise of the automobile. This expansion map reflects the rapid growth of interurban railways and the competition to keep growing or go bust.

This Age of Steam expansion map features a Power Plant track in place of the Engine (Locomotive) track of the base game and requires players to make deliveries equal to or greater than their best delivery. All players start in hexes adjacent to Kansas City and expand outwards. The initial cost for the starting spaces and building a power plant make the beginning game very costly. Players must carefully consider pushing forward for longer deliveries because once they are done, there is no going back to shorter deliveries.

This expansion map was released for attendees of the  inaugural Age of Steam Con in March 2018 and then made available for purchase at and after HeavyCon in May 2018.

Name: Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin? 2
Description:
The objective of Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin? 2 ("Where did I hear it?" 2) is to guess the quote: which movie, song, novel etc. is it.
This time all quotes are connected with Estonia.

Player who guesses correctly moves forward on the game board.
The player who finishes first is the winner.

Name: Grand Football Mexico 86
Description: A Pinball, which theme is the World Cup 86 - Mexico, who took place in Mexico. This board game, was created by greek toy company  "Lyra" in 1985. The winner is the player who scored the most goals. Every player has six chances/balls to score. If the ball, fell into holes, there are two possibilities: Missed shot or try again  Great fun, for two players!

Name: Tajniacy: Obcy Agenci
Description:
Polish third mini-expansion

Consist of 10 new cards (with 20 new codenames) in Polish.

Can be mixed with both regular Codenames (Tajniacy), Codenames Undercover (Tajniacy: Bez Cenzury), Codenames Duet (Tajniacy: Duet) or even Codenames Pictures (Tajniacy: Obrazki) if using mixed Word/Pictures game variant.

Name: The Greatest Snake: Kickstarter Exclusive Booster Pack
Description: A Kickstarter Exclusive booster pack with 25 additional cards (originally 18), making a 5 player game possible. With 5 players, you can now become the Even Greaterest Snake!

Name: The Savings Game
Description:
A simplistic roll & move game deriving from Landlord game variants like Monopoly. In this game the players receive 'income' cards which earn them money and 'expenditure' cards which cost them money, and can keep their money either in cash or savings account, that latter of which recieve interest (the game includes a calculator) based on the current interest rates.
The game is intended as an educational tool and was supported by the Britannia Building Society 'borne out of our desire for financila education to be made available for all school children'.

Name: Face to Face
Description:
OUR KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN BEGINS NOVEMBER 5!  COME SUPPORT US!

Something has gone very wrong with the world!  Animals have been separated from the places they belong - can you help put them back?

In the card game Face to Face, players work to match animal halves and return them to their respective habitats.  The game contains 4 different habitats (arctic, jungle, savannah, and pasture); each habitat has 4 different animals available.

The game begins with two shuffled decks of cards - "Place" cards and "Face" cards.  These are placed where all players can reach them.  The player who has had the most exotic pet goes first.  On his/her turn, each player can select a maximum of 2 of the following actions:  (1) take a card from either deck; (2) put a card down; (3) trade a card with another player; (4) discard a card; or (5) pass.  Players' hands may not exceed 7 cards.

Players get points for the matched pairs they place down on the animals' correct habitats.  First player to 10 points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Root Guy Farm
Description:
Shim and D'rothy's first board game for kids and people of all ages, Root Guy Farm is an old-fashioned roll-the-dice board game that encourages interaction and storytelling. Some of the spaces are just silly, while others prompt your kids to talk about their favorite food, items they would bring on a trip, or to tell a joke. The winner is prompted to make up a story about the mysterious "Root Guy Farm." This game will bring the family together with laughs, creativity, and imagination.
 The game board is printed in full-color at actual size of the original colored pencil artwork, 24" by 18". The paper game board is fully laminated, so it can't be easily ruined by spills. The game is shipped with a 6-sided die and 5 colorful game pieces.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jojojo
Description:
Jojojo is a storytelling cardgame about exploring people's personalities through questions.

The question cards were carefully crafted and thoroughly playtested (more than 700 iterations) to challenge the players to reveal details about themselves through a narrative lens. It's hard to have pre-made answers, so conversations become energetic, challenging, memorable.

With different game modes, the rules adapt to the number of people playing, the depth of conversation they want and how well they know each other. The goal is always the same: tell stories.
